definitions.title: n.pr.m.
definitions.body: flum. Eupharates, Eufrathv (As. Purattu Dl:Pa.169 ff., Whence O Pers, Ufrâtu, Spieg:APK 211);—the greatest river of W. Asia; ´[[פ]] Ge 2:14. ´[[נְהַר פ]] Ge 15:18; (both secondary phrases in J), ´[[נְהַר פ]] also 2Sa 83 (Qr, v. [[נָהָר]]), Je 46:2, Je 46:6, Je 46:10, De 1:7, De 11:24; Jos 1:4 (D), 2Ki 23:29, 2Ki 24:7, 1Ch 5:9, 1Ch 18:3; [[נהר]] om. Je 13:4, Je 13:5, Je 13:6, Je 13:7 (where Ew Hi Marti, after Schick:ZPV iii. ll, think of some other [[פְּרָת]], but Gf Gie and most defend Euphrates) Je 51:63, 2Ch 35:20 (cf. Ge 2:14 supr.); name not certainly attested before D Je; on earlier [[הַנָּהָר]] for this river v. ´[[נ]].
